DataElement.preferredName: Connective Tissue Disease Daily Medication Usage Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient takes daily medication for connective tissue disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Connective Tissue Disease Daily Medication Usage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A heterogeneous group of disorders, some hereditary, others acquired, characterized by abnormal structure or function of one or more of the elements of connective tissue, i.e., collagen, elastin, or the mucopolysaccharides.__Occurring or done each day._A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Connective Tissue Disorder Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A heterogeneous group of disorders, some hereditary, others acquired, characterized by abnormal structure or function of one or more of the elements of connective tissue, i.e., collagen, elastin, or the mucopolysaccharides.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the connective tissue.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring or done each day.:A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.                           :A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
